snippet: A Los Angeles County ordinance requiring actors in sex films to use condoms does not violate the industry’s First Amendment rights of free expression, a federal appeals court ruled Monday.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules Los Angeles County ordinance requiring actors in sex films to use condoms does not violate the industry’s First Amendment rights of free expression.
lead_paragraph: A Los Angeles County ordinance requiring actors in sex films to use condoms does not violate the industry’s First Amendment rights of free expression, a federal appeals court ruled Monday.

headline.main: California: Court Upholds Condom Rule for Actors in Pornographic Films
headline.print_headline: California: Court Upholds Condom Rule for Actors
